actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights

official_title: To establish a new Civil Rights Commission, and for other purposes.
short_title: United States Commission on Civil Rights Act of 1989
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues
subjects_top_term: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: United States Commission on Civil Rights Act of 1989 - Reestablishes the United States Commission on Civil Rights comprised of nine-members appointed by the President. Enumerates the Commission's duties in allegations of discrimination on the basis of color, race, religion, sex, age, disability, or national origin. Reestablishes other commission operations and procedures, including annual reports, administrative functions, hearings procedures, and other matters, including a prohibition on studies of abortion. Adds to Commission duties a requirement for appraisal of denials of equal protection of the laws involving Americans of eastern-European and southern European ethnic groups.

titles.title: United States Commission on Civil Rights Act of 1989
To establish a new Civil Rights Commission, and for other purposes.
